channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @ashkenazthree @SamZimra @zackamenetz All else being equal, probable more amenable to a posthumous summoning that Eliezer Berkovits.
item.source:markdown: @ashkenazthree @SamZimra @zackamenetz All else being equal, probable more amenable to a posthumous summoning that Eliezer Berkovits.

item.description: @Atrios Now tell them about Andrew and Trig, I think it was.
item.source:markdown: @Atrios Now tell them about Andrew and Trig, I think it was.

item.description:
@Mottel There is something objectively funny about approaching strange Lubavitcher on street corners, since it’s such a reversal.

@Mottel The question is what question can you ask that wouldn’t be offensive and would elicit funny responses.

@Mottel Probably one of those that the ger asked Hillel.
@XLProfessor @StarTrek There is an Orion girl on Lower Decks.
item.source:markdown: @XLProfessor @StarTrek There is an Orion girl on Lower Decks.

item.description: @KosherSoul @N_S_Dolkart Absent a navy, transliterations are just vibes. With a navy, you get Beijing.
item.source:markdown: @KosherSoul @N_S_Dolkart Absent a navy, transliterations are just vibes. With a navy, you get Beijing.

item.description: @typolad Lo Bashanayim Hi: A Halachic Defense of Joining the Mile High Club.
item.source:markdown: @typolad Lo Bashanayim Hi: A Halachic Defense of Joining the Mile High Club.

item.description:
@Ring_Sheryl Not for profit; for political ideology. The roots of this goes back to pretty soon after Ferguson.

@Ring_Sheryl I say “not for profit” because there is big money behind this. DB gets a steady paycheck to advance this agenda; the book is part of the project, not an attempt to make money.

@Ring_Sheryl Again, my DMs are open to anyone who wants to write a book length rebuttal to this book (or others of this ilk) or who wants to fund such a writing project (and yes, such donations would be tax deductible.)
@Stonekettle I think by this point his lawyers come with their brains already pickled. Tired: “What a waste it is to have no mind.” Wired: “What an opportunity it is to find a lawyer with no mind.”
item.source:markdown: @Stonekettle I think by this point his lawyers come with their brains already pickled. Tired: “What a waste it is to have no mind.” Wired: “What an opportunity it is to find a lawyer with no mind.”

item.description: @trekonomics Hmmm. The Greyhound from Rochester to Syracuse from somehow less alluring.
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics Hmmm. The Greyhound from Rochester to Syracuse from somehow less alluring.

item.description:
@JamesFallows I would love to see someone talk about (1) what the flow of (variously) classified documents on the POTUS desk looks like and (2) what are the Archive's provisions for getting souvenir tchotkes into the offices of a FPOTUS and

@JamesFallows (3) how many current and former government officials (including military) have had access to Secret material and have been trained to recoil at the mishandling of such documents.
item.source:markdown:
@JamesFallows I would love to see someone talk about (1) what the flow of (variously) classified documents on the POTUS desk looks like and (2) what are the Archive's provisions for getting souvenir tchotkes into the offices of a FPOTUS and
@JamesFallows (3) how many current and former government officials (including military) have had access to Secret material and have been trained to recoil at the mishandling of such documents.

item.description: @AryehCW As it is written: "There's a hustle in the hedge row."
item.source:markdown: @AryehCW As it is written: "There's a hustle in the hedge row."

item.description: @elivalley Sounds like it's time for him to start applying to yeshivas...
item.source:markdown: @elivalley Sounds like it's time for him to start applying to yeshivas...

item.description: @EvelKneidel If anyone wants to write a book length rejoinder — or help me hire someone else to do so — I would be delighted to publish it.
item.source:markdown: @EvelKneidel If anyone wants to write a book length rejoinder — or help me hire someone else to do so — I would be delighted to publish it.

item.description: @fliglman All present-day poultry, however….

item.description: This is the synthesis that Yeshiva University — or at least Meir Soliveitchik’s Center for Jewish Political Thought or whatever — wants. https://t.co/WVnT33ulr5

item.description: Great story. For which, in the version I’m publishing in this week’s @JewishStandard, I used the headline: “They threw the Jews down the well.” https://t.co/DrrYZ417lw
item.source:markdown: Great story. For which, in the version I’m publishing in this week’s @JewishStandard, I used the headline: “They threw the Jews down the well.” https://t.co/DrrYZ417lw

item.description: @MollyJongFast @NathanJRobinson Counterpoint: You and I still need to work for a living, yet here we are.
item.source:markdown: @MollyJongFast @NathanJRobinson Counterpoint: You and I still need to work for a living, yet here we are.

item.description: @MollyJongFast @NathanJRobinson I feel that twitter needs to be novelized. I’d love to see a review comparing Rowling’s effort with other attempts.
item.source:markdown: @MollyJongFast @NathanJRobinson I feel that twitter needs to be novelized. I’d love to see a review comparing Rowling’s effort with other attempts.

item.description: @dzkalman Is flying better or worse than driving per passenger mile? I know it’s safer by a factor of ten.
item.source:markdown: @dzkalman Is flying better or worse than driving per passenger mile? I know it’s safer by a factor of ten.

item.description: @NathanJRobinson But isn’t that the life we all lead today?
item.source:markdown: @NathanJRobinson But isn’t that the life we all lead today?

item.description: @trekonomics Glad to see my policy of spending recess reading rather than playing ball vindicated at last.
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics Glad to see my policy of spending recess reading rather than playing ball vindicated at last.

item.description: @NathanJRobinson So it is a useful cautionary tale.
item.source:markdown: @NathanJRobinson So it *is* a useful cautionary tale.

item.description: @CCat2001 @froomkin @pbump Why did Gollum hold on to the ring?

item.description: @AvBronstein 17 or 19: Which amendment was worse? A PragerU debate.

item.description:
@miriamudel @onthemainline It's Leynin Siddur by Joseph Magil. (Courtesy of https://t.co/8z5MaVXbLE). Should I send it to Emory? What office?

@miriamudel @onthemainline Oy. I can't print a copy now because Amazon no longer supports Hebrew books. But perhaps it's time to tidy it up and publish properly.
item.source:markdown:
@miriamudel @onthemainline It's Leynin Siddur by Joseph Magil. (Courtesy of https://t.co/8z5MaVXbLE). Should I send it to Emory? What office?
@miriamudel @onthemainline Oy. I can't print a copy now because Amazon no longer supports Hebrew books. But perhaps it's time to tidy it up and publish properly.
